Killing the messenger, literally.

A tyrant who was very popular before he wasn't.
The Opium Wars, which were exactly what they sound like.
A colonial border drawn with a ruler.
An assassination in an open-top car.
A détente that fixed absolutely nothing.
Operation Paperclip.
The Stanford Prison Experiment.
A CIA experiment on unsuspecting civilians.
Vietnam, as a learning experience.
Manifest Destiny applied to space.
The fall of Constantinople, very badly timed.
Crusaders doing 'God's work' in everyone else's cities.
Medieval surgery.
Trepanation to let the demons out.
A leeching session prescribed by a physician.
The Great Fire of London blamed on a French baker.
An heir to the throne murdered by an uncle.
A marriage alliance that caused more wars.
A papal schism at the most inconvenient moment.
The entire history of Ireland.
The Louisiana Purchase from a country that didn't own it.
A general promoted above his competence level.
A peace treaty signed before the fighting stopped.
An arms race that made everyone less safe.
A despot with a cult of personality.
Poisoning the king with his own physician's help.
A revolution that ate its own leaders.
Colonial taxation without representation.
A monopoly on salt.
A famine while exporting food.
Flag-planting on a land already full of flags.
The invention of public relations to cover up a massacre.
Five-cent propaganda.
An ethnic cleansing rebranded as 'resettlement'.
A torture manual approved by the church.
A confession extracted with great enthusiasm.
History, repeating itself immediately.
A peace treaty that made the next war inevitable.
An empire that collapsed due to tax evasion.

pop_culture.name: 🎬 Pop Culture Pack
pop_culture.description: Celebrities, films, music, and the beautiful disasters they create.
white: An Oscar for Best Reaction to Losing.
A celebrity feud that ended civilization.
The song that played when you lost your virginity.
A Netflix show cancelled after one season.
A Marvel movie nobody asked for.
A celebrity apology written by a PR team.
A tabloid headline that was technically true.
The celebrity couple that broke your heart.
An album that took 10 years and was not worth it.
A reality TV villain who was right.
A reboot of something that was perfect.
A franchise stretched past the point of dignity.
A leaked text message from a pop star.
An awards show nobody watched.
A chart-topping song about nothing.
An actor who peaked in 1997.
A director's cut that made it worse.
A celebrity fashion choice that haunts us.
Getting papped falling out of a limo.
A beef that started on Twitter.
A documentary that revealed too much.
An SNL impression that destroyed a career.
A halftime show that needed more budget.
A late-night monologue as therapy.
A streaming service nobody remembers paying for.
A cinematic universe that collapsed under its own weight.
A music video that needed more explanation.
A celebrity who owns an island.
A reality star who ran for office.
A podcast interview that should not have happened.
A celebrity diet that costs $900 a week.
Goop.
A sex tape that launched a career.
A child actor's inevitable breakdown.
A meme that outlived its subject.
A posthumous album released by the estate.
A crossover episode between two dying shows.
A live-action remake of your childhood.
A brand deal with a problematic company.
A deleted tweet that the internet never forgot.
A fashion trend from 2003 that came back.
A red carpet look that broke the internet.
A viral moment someone deeply regrets.
The band that broke up but got back together for money.
A celebrity baby name.
A behind-the-scenes documentary that showed everything was terrible.
An exclusive interview that backfired spectacularly.
A chart topper that's actually just noise.
A franchise entry that retconned everything.
A star who went method and never came back.
A biopic nobody wanted.
A feud between two musicians who've never met.
A limited series that justified nothing.
A prestige drama that became a meme.
An actor refusing to accept the character is dead.
A director who said 'we never used CGI' (they definitely used CGI).
A diva rider that included very specific M&Ms.
An unhinged late-night Twitter thread.
A world tour postponed for 'personal reasons'.
A Grammy given to the wrong album.
A walk of fame star that keeps getting vandalized.
A celebrity chef with no citations.
A stadium concert that was just PowerPoint slides.
A supergroup that lasted one album.
An action hero who is now a wellness influencer.
A villain played so well you rooted for them.
A casting choice that caused riots.
A plot hole the entire fandom obsesses over.
An unnecessary sequel that made everyone sad.
A shock twist that ruined five seasons of buildup.
A cult following for an objectively bad movie.
A sci-fi franchise explained by someone at a party.
A director's vision and a studio's interference.
An adaptation that missed the point entirely.
A special effects budget going entirely on one scene.
A ship that should have sailed.
The deleted scene that would have fixed the ending.
A celebrity friendship that is clearly PR.
A red carpet interview answered completely wrong.
A live performance that was mimed.
An artist's 'experimental phase' that lasted too long.
A chart position bought by streaming farms.
A one-hit wonder who peaked at 19.
A retraction from a gossip magazine.
A comeback tour where nobody bought tickets.
A deep-cut track that fans prefer over all the hits.
A celebrity who 'went off the grid' for two weeks.
An awards speech that thanked everyone except the right people.
A fashion collaboration that sold out in seconds and looked terrible.
A beef that ended with a diss track nobody remembers.
A child star's Wikipedia page at age 30.
A breakup album that really should have stayed private.
A tabloid exclusive sourced from 'a friend close to the couple'.
A franchise rights dispute that left everyone in legal hell.
A streaming original movie that cost $200 million and was forgotten in a week.
A documentary filmmaker who became the story.
A sequel greenlit before the first one came out.
A celebrity cameo that ruined the whole film.
An entire franchise rebooted because the IP was cheap.
A studio note that destroyed a classic ending.

existential_dread.name: 😶‍🌫️ Existential Dread Pack
existential_dread.description: For when the void stares back and you have to finish your shift anyway.
white: The persistent feeling that everyone else got a manual you didn't.
Realizing mid-laugh that nothing matters.
The 3am certainty that you have wasted your life.
Free will, but it's actually just neurons firing.
The version of yourself you gave up on.
Being a temporary arrangement of atoms that is very stressed about email.
The slow creep of realizing your parents were just guessing the whole time.
Looking in the mirror and not recognizing anything.
The knowledge that the sun will eventually consume the Earth.
Consciousness as a cruel evolutionary accident.
The exact moment you stopped believing things would work out.
A Wikipedia rabbit hole that ends at 'heat death of the universe'.
All your future memories that will never exist.
The yawning void behind a customer service smile.
Trying to remember who you were before the internet.
The quiet horror of a Sunday afternoon with nothing to do.
Mortality, presented without comment.
The suspicion that your entire personality is just coping mechanisms.
Every door you didn't open.
The word 'legacy' when applied to yourself.
Completing your to-do list and feeling absolutely nothing.
Waving back at someone who was waving at someone else, forever.
The inexorable passage of time, as experienced in a dentist's waiting room.
Existential dread wearing a business casual outfit.
A birthday that made you do math.
The specific loneliness of being in a crowded room.
Choosing a career at 17 and living with it at 45.
The part of your brain that replays your worst moments at 2am.
Asking 'is this all there is?' and receiving no answer.
The unsettling sameness of every single day.
Impermanence, gift-wrapped.
The growing suspicion that you are the problem.
Watching your parents get old.
A nostalgia for a past that wasn't even that good.
The career path not taken, now occasionally Googled.
How little anyone will remember you in 200 years.
The distance between who you are and who you meant to be.
Time, moving faster every year for no good reason.
Making peace with something you haven't made peace with.
The small death of every unreturned phone call.
Your consciousness, unable to verify it is real.
The moment you realized you were mortal, and every moment since.
Staring at a wall and understanding it completely.
Running out of people who knew the younger version of you.
The version of your life you sometimes still imagine.
A late night spent calculating how many weekends you have left.
The specific grief of an unmade choice.
Dying before you figure out what the point was.
The terrifying freedom of being entirely responsible for your own meaning.
A universe that is not cruel, not kind, and utterly indifferent.
The half-second before sleep when you remember something you did in 2009.
Camus, shrugging.
A Sartre quote used correctly, which makes it worse.
The Ship of Theseus, applied to your own personality.
Nietzsche's abyss, now with a Yelp page.
Kierkegaard's anxiety as a lifestyle brand.
The question your philosophy professor asked that you still haven't answered.
Heidegger's 'being-toward-death,' gift-wrapped.
The part of Pascal's Wager nobody likes to think about.
Schopenhauer at a birthday party.
A perfectly ordinary Tuesday that will never happen again.
Simone de Beauvoir being right about everything.
The exact moment you became your parents.
Wittgenstein's silence on the things that cannot be spoken.
The Absurd, but it's Monday.
An unanswerable question asked by a child.
Your oldest unopened email.
The dream where you're back in school and realize you're also already dead.
Accepting that your best years may be behind you while still at the buffet.
The specific ache of a song you loved at 16.
Every photograph of yourself where you looked happy but weren't.
The retirement plan you haven't started.
Looking at baby photos and understanding that person is gone.
The last conversation you'll ever have with someone, not knowing it's the last.
Your own handwriting from twenty years ago.
The hobby you quit right before you would have gotten good at it.
A to-do list found in a coat pocket from three years ago, all incomplete.
The person you promised to call back.
A life insurance form filled out in your own handwriting.
The exact weight of unlived experience.
The silence after a house becomes empty.
A city you grew up in, returned to, and no longer recognized.
Realizing you can't remember your grandmother's voice.
The last time you did something for the first time.
The word 'yet' quietly leaving most of your sentences.
Running out of road metaphors for life.
The awareness that you are narrating your own experience in real time.
Your last coherent thought, whenever that turns out to be.
Infinite regress, but make it personal.
The mirror at an angle that shows how you look from behind.
A god-shaped hole, exactly god-shaped.
The moment you realized your childhood home was just a house.
Every apology you rehearsed and never gave.
Time spent waiting that you cannot get back.
The version of yourself that died with every decade.
The strange grief of outgrowing a dream.
An old journal that reads like someone you'd find annoying now.
Checking whether you are living or just completing tasks.
The long pause in the middle of asking 'what's the point?'
The horizon, which you will never reach, moving with you always.

black.text: At the end of the day, we are all just _.
I have come to terms with my mortality. Less so with _.
The philosophers were unable to answer the question of _.
What fills the silence after you stop distracting yourself?
I searched for meaning and found only _.
In the grand tapestry of existence, you are _ and you are running out of time.
The last thing I will think before I die is _.
My therapist says I need to confront _. My therapist is right.
The universe is 13.8 billion years old. You have spent most of that time worrying about _.
What is the shape of a life wasted on _?
Sisyphus had his boulder. I have _.
Deep down, beneath all the noise, there is only _.
In the end, we are remembered for _ and nothing else.
Camus said we must imagine Sisyphus happy. Camus never had to deal with _.
Sartre said hell is other people. He had not yet encountered _.
I asked the void what it all means. The void said _.
The examined life is not worth living if it contains _.
Nietzsche warned us about _. We did not listen.
What is the sound of one hand clapping? What is the sound of _?
The midlife crisis peaked when I bought _ and realized it didn't help.
On my deathbed I will not regret the things I did. I will regret _.
The self is an illusion constructed to cope with _.
Memento mori. Also, _.
I have accepted my mortality. I have not accepted _ and I never will.
What waits for us beyond the void? Probably _.

lovecraftian.name: 🐙 Cosmic Horror Pack
lovecraftian.description: Something old. Something patient. Something aware of you now.
white: Something vast and patient, watching from a distance that has no name.
The geometry of the room, subtly wrong.
A color that does not exist in the visible spectrum but somehow you have seen it.
An ancient thing that finds you mildly interesting.
The drowned city beneath the city beneath your city.
A sound from below the floorboards that is almost a word.
The part of the ocean that has never been lit.
Something with too many joints, moving with purpose.
The book that changes every time you open it.
A door in your basement that was not there yesterday and is warm to the touch.
Stars that have been watching you specifically.
The thing that follows you only in peripheral vision.
An entity that does not want to eat you. It wants something far less comfortable.
A whisper in a language that predates language.
The recurring dream that is becoming more accurate.
Sanity as a thin membrane stretched over an infinite dark.
An old god who does not know you are there, which is the best-case scenario.
The cultists who seem very happy, which is the most disturbing part.
Time behaving incorrectly in the basement.
The lighthouse that signals something that should not be signaled.
A hand pressed against the other side of the mirror.
The village where everyone smiles too long after the joke ends.
Something enormous moving slowly beneath the surface.
The manuscript that the author destroyed, and it keeps coming back.
A priest of a god whose name is only safe to say once.
The fog that came in last Tuesday and brought something with it.
A face you recognize that has no right to be on that body.
The ritual that was supposed to close the door.
The angle at which the shadows fall in that room and no other room.
A hymn sung in frequencies that loosen the teeth.
The archive of everything that has ever been forgotten.
That which dwells in the space between one thought and the next.
An invitation written in a script that your eyes keep sliding off of.
The horizon, approaching.
An archaeologist who found what she was looking for and wishes she hadn't.
The part of your mind you cannot access and should not try.
Tendrils of something that has mistaken you for a door.
A covenant made by your ancestors on behalf of everyone.
The voice in the static that knows your full name.
A map that shows places that are not and roads that should not connect.
The old house that the neighborhood has forgotten to forget.
Something wearing the shape of what you love.
An eye the size of a building, briefly visible through cloud cover.
The correct number of teeth in a human mouth, plus several more.
A congregation gathered around an absence.
The signal that the radio has been receiving since 1954.
A god sleeping under the ice who is beginning to dream.
The deep place where something ancient decided to wait.
Something that emerged from the water looking like it had been practicing.
The last rational thought before understanding.
Cthulhu, mildly inconvenienced.
R'lyeh's HOA fees.
Nyarlathotep in middle management.
The Necronomicon's table of contents.
Azathoth, dreaming at the center of all things, utterly unaware.
Shoggoth as a roommate.
The Deep Ones' dental plan.
Dagon's fishing tips.
Miskatonic University's course catalog.
Arkham after dark.
Yog-Sothoth, who is the gate and the key and also somehow your landlord.
Innsmouth's tourism board.
The Yellow Sign on a Post-it note.
The King in Yellow's Yelp review.
A Ph'nglui mwgl nafh Cthulhu R'lyeh wgah'nagl fhtagn bumper sticker.
The Colour Out of Space, now available in a paint swatch.
Herbert West's Reanimator referral program.
Pickman's model portfolio.
The Dunwich Horror's babysitter.
The Shadow Over Innsmouth, but it's a gentrification metaphor.
Wilbur Whateley at career day.
The Mi-Go brain canister frequent flyer program.
The Elder Things' Yelp rating.
At the Mountains of Madness, but it's a ski resort now.
A shoggoth that has unionized.
The Hounds of Tindalos in your corners, because all corners are wrong.
The Whisperer in Darkness leaving passive-aggressive notes.
A Great Race of Yith time-share.
The Shadow Out of Time, as a relatable workday.
Hastur's preferred mode of communication (don't say his name).
The Silver Key, used to open something that should stay closed.
Randolph Carter's gap year.
The statement of Randolph Carter, exhibit A.
A byakhee Uber.
Nyarlathotep's LinkedIn.
The Black Pharaoh on a Tuesday.
The Crawling Chaos, crawling specifically toward your inbox.
Shub-Niggurath's thousand young daycare.
The Goat with a Thousand Young's PTA meeting.
An Elder Sign used as a coaster.
The Plateau of Leng's off-season rates.
A Dimensional Shambler that only appears during tax season.
The Fungi from Yuggoth doing content creation.
The Dreamlands, but the commute is terrible.
Deep One heritage discovered via 23andMe.
Cthulhu fhtagn as an out-of-office reply.
The Church of Starry Wisdom's pledge drive.
A ghoul with impeccable table manners.
The Nameless City, finally getting a name (it's Glen).
Robert Chambers' King in Yellow as required corporate reading.

black.text: The investigators found _, which explained everything and helped no one.
That which cannot be named has a preference for _.
The ritual required _ and the willingness to not ask what it was for.
We should not have opened the door. Behind it was _ and also _.
The fishermen of the old village refused to speak of _.
The stars aligned and from the deep there rose _.
The last page of the journal read only: '_ is already here.'
You have been chosen. The choosing involved _.
The thing that came through the door was not _ anymore.
Humanity's greatest mistake was not the bomb, but _.
It does not want to destroy us. It wants _ and that is so much worse.
The archaeologist's final transmission mentioned only _ before the signal cut out.
The mercy of it is that you will not remember _. The horror is that part of you will.
Ph'nglui mwgl nafh Cthulhu R'lyeh wgah'nagl fhtagn, but make it about _.
The Miskatonic University rejected my application due to _.
Cthulhu rose from R'lyeh and his first demand was _.
The Necronomicon's most dangerous chapter is the one about _.
Nyarlathotep walks among us, currently disguised as _.
The Deep Ones will inherit the Earth. They plan to replace _ first.
Even Azathoth, blind idiot god at the center of chaos, would be disturbed by _.
The cultists chanted for hours. What they summoned was _, which was somehow worse.
Herbert West assured me the reanimation was a success. He did not mention _.
The Innsmouth look can be masked with _ and a good hat.
I said Hastur's name three times and what appeared was not Hastur but _.
The stars were finally right. What emerged from the deep wanted only _.
